desc: List all files including hidden, detailed view
explanation: Lists directory contents. -l shows long format (permissions, owner, size, time), -a includes hidden dotfiles.

desc: Go up one directory
explanation: Changes the current working directory. '..' goes up one level.

desc: Show current working directory
explanation: Prints the full path of the current working directory.

desc: Print text 'Hello World' to the terminal
explanation: Prints the given text/variable to standard output.

desc: Create a directory named 'test'
explanation: Creates directories. With -p, also creates parent directories as needed.

desc: Create nested directories 'src/utils'
explanation: Creates directories. With -p, also creates parent directories as needed.

desc: Remove an empty directory named 'test'
explanation: Removes an empty directory. Fails if the directory is not empty.

desc: Create an empty file called notes.txt
explanation: Creates an empty file or updates the file's modification time if it exists.

desc: Display the contents of notes.txt
explanation: Concatenates and prints file contents to standard output.

desc: Show the first 5 lines of notes.txt
explanation: Shows the first N lines of a file; -n 5 shows five lines.

desc: Show the last 10 lines of notes.txt
explanation: Shows the last N lines of a file. With -f, follows new lines as they are written.

desc: Count the number of lines in notes.txt
explanation: Counts lines (-l), words (-w), and bytes (-c) for files.

desc: Copy file a.txt to b.txt
explanation: Copies files or directories.

desc: Move file a.txt into folder backup/
explanation: Moves or renames files or directories.

desc: Delete a file called old.log
explanation: Removes files. Use with care; deleted files are not sent to trash.

desc: Show calendar for current month
explanation: Displays a calendar for the current month (or given month/year).

desc: Display the current date and time
explanation: Prints or sets the system date and time.

desc: Show disk usage in human-readable format
explanation: Shows disk space usage of filesystems. -h uses human-readable units.

desc: Show memory usage in human-readable format
explanation: Displays system memory usage. -h uses human-readable units.

desc: Clear the terminal screen
explanation: Clears the terminal display.

desc: Print only the first column of data.csv (comma separated)
explanation: Extracts sections from each line. -d sets delimiter, -f selects fields.

desc: Sort the contents of list.txt alphabetically
explanation: Sorts lines of text alphabetically or numerically (with flags).

desc: Show unique lines from list.txt
explanation: Filters adjacent duplicate lines; often used after sort.

desc: Chain commands: list files then show current directory
explanation: Lists directory contents. -l shows long format (permissions, owner, size, time), -a includes hidden dotfiles.

desc: Redirect output of ls to files.txt
explanation: Lists directory contents. -l shows long format (permissions, owner, size, time), -a includes hidden dotfiles.

desc: Append output of date to log.txt
explanation: Prints or sets the system date and time.

desc: Show currently logged-in user
explanation: Prints the effective username.

desc: Search for the word 'TODO' in notes.txt
explanation: Searches input for lines matching a pattern. Supports regex and many flags.

desc: Search case-insensitively for 'error' in logs.txt
explanation: Searches input for lines matching a pattern. Supports regex and many flags.

desc: Display running processes for current shell session
explanation: Shows processes associated with the current shell. Use 'ps aux' for all processes.

desc: Show the current shell in use
explanation: Prints the given text/variable to standard output.

desc: Show your default shell
explanation: Prints the given text/variable to standard output.

desc: Display system uptime
explanation: Shows how long the system has been running and the average system load.

desc: Search history for a previous command containing 'ssh'
explanation: Prints shell command history; piping to grep filters matching entries.

desc: Display current user ID and group IDs
explanation: Shows user identity information: UID, GID, and group memberships.

desc: Search recursively for 'ERROR' under logs/
explanation: Searches input for lines matching a pattern. Supports regex and many flags.

desc: Show listening TCP/UDP ports
explanation: Lists sockets/ports. -tuln: TCP/UDP, listening, don't resolve names.

desc: List files sorted by size, human-readable
explanation: Lists directory contents. -l shows long format (permissions, owner, size, time), -a includes hidden dotfiles.

desc: Follow a growing log file named app.log
explanation: Shows the last N lines of a file. With -f, follows new lines as they are written.

desc: Show the difference between file1.txt and file2.txt
explanation: Compares files line-by-line and prints differences.

desc: Find all Python files in the current directory and subdirectories
explanation: Searches directory trees for files matching name/size/time and more.

desc: Find files larger than 10MB in /var/log
explanation: Searches directory trees for files matching name/size/time and more.

desc: Make script.sh executable
explanation: Changes file mode bits (permissions). 'u+x' adds execute for user.

desc: Change owner of file.txt to user alice
explanation: Changes file owner (and optionally group). Requires privileges for others' files.

desc: Extract an archive backup.tar.gz into current directory
explanation: Creates or extracts tar archives; -z uses gzip compression.

desc: Find all .js files under src/
explanation: Searches directory trees for files matching name/size/time and more.

desc: Use grep to find lines with numbers in data.txt
explanation: Searches input for lines matching a pattern. Supports regex and many flags.

desc: Search for 'main' function in all .c files
explanation: Searches input for lines matching a pattern. Supports regex and many flags.

desc: Pack the current directory into a compressed tarball backup.tar.gz excluding node_modules
explanation: Creates or extracts tar archives; -z uses gzip compression.

desc: Find and delete all .tmp files under /tmp older than 7 days
explanation: Searches directory trees for files matching name/size/time and more.
